sentence.Network_en: The mere mention of John had touched a very raw nerve indeed.
sentence.Network_cn: 提到约翰就真的让人心痛。

sentence.Network_en: The mere mention of food had triggered off hunger pangs.
sentence.Network_cn: 单单提到食物就引起了阵阵饥饿感。

sentence.Network_en: He's a mere slip of a lad compared to his brother.
sentence.Network_cn: 跟他哥哥一比，他不过是个小毛孩。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the senses 'pure' and 'sheer, downright'): from Latin merus 'undiluted'
Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch meer 'lake' and German Meer 'sea', from an Indo-European root shared by Russian more and Latin mare

entry.def: You use mere to emphasize how unimportant or inadequate something is, in comparison to the general situation you are describing.

example.ex: ...successful exhibitions which go beyond mere success...
example.tran: 不仅仅是成功而是大获成功的展览

example.ex: There is more to good health than the mere absence of disease...
example.tran: 身体健康不仅仅指不生病，还包括更多。

entry.tran: 极小的，微不足道的，单单(表示虽小却有重要影响)
entry.def: You use mere to indicate that a quality or action that is usually unimportant has a very important or strong effect.

example.ex: The mere mention of food had triggered off hunger pangs...
example.tran: 单单提到食物就引起了阵阵饥饿感。

example.ex: Whenever there was a gap in the traffic the merest pressure on the accelerator was enough to close it...
example.tran: 每当车流里出现了一点儿空距，只要稍稍一踩油门，空距就没有了。

entry.tran: 只不过，仅仅(用于强调数量之小)
entry.def: You use mere to emphasize how small a particular amount or number is.

example.ex: Sixty per cent of teachers are women, but a mere 5 percent of women are heads and deputies...
example.tran: 有60%的教师是女性，但是担任校长和副校长的女性仅占5%。

example.ex: Tickets are a mere £7.50 at the door...

means.word_mean: 1. a small pond of standing water
2. apart from anything else; without additions or modifications;

sentences.sentence: "the simple passage of time was enough"

auth_sentence.content: Forget the mere points or position in the table.
auth_sentence.res_content: Forget the mere points or position in the table.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Forget the mere points or position in the table.

auth_sentence.content: It's much more than a mere stopgap release.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's much more than a mere stopgap release.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's much more than a mere stopgap release.

auth_sentence.content: But these are mere dots on the vast ocean.
auth_sentence.res_content: But these are mere dots on the vast ocean.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But these are mere dots on the vast ocean.

Sentence.sentence: a mere skeleton of traditional textbooks
It is actually something deeper than mere happiness: it is joy, which the monk（僧侣）David Steindl-Rast describes as "that kind of happiness that doesn't depend on what happens.
Another part of the study suggests far more is at stake than the mere expression of views.
The independence created by philosophical insight is—in my opinion—the mark of distinction between a mere artisan (工匠) or specialist and a real seeker after truth," Einstein wrote in 1944.

sentences.en: It took her a mere 20 minutes to win.
A mere 2% of their budget has been spent on publicity.
sentences.cn: 他们的预算开支只有2%用于宣传。

sentences.en: He seemed so young, a mere boy.
sentences.cn: 他看来那么年轻，只是个孩子。

sentences.en: You've got the job. the interview will be a mere formality.
sentences.cn: 你已经得到了这份工作。面试不过是个形式。

sentences.en: It was mere waste of breath to argue with a person in so unreasonable a state of mind.
sentences.cn: 与一个如此不讲道理的人争论纯粹是浪费口舌。

means.word_mean: 只凭…就足以 (只用于名词前)

sentences.en: The mere thought of eating made him feel sick.
sentences.cn: 他一想到吃饭就觉得恶心.

sentences.en: The mere fact that they were prepared to talk was encouraging.
sentences.cn: 他们愿意商谈，这就很不错了。

jushi.english: It is a mere matter of time.
The cut was a mere scratch.
It was mere waste of breath to argue with a person in so unreasonable a state of mind.
jushi.chinese: 与一个如此不讲道理的人争论纯粹是浪费口舌。
